messages.message: hey @Dominic Fannjiang any update on this?
Making the backport PR, but still trying to reproduce the issue on 23.01

Update - I've reproduced the issue. seems to be something specific with the SwapDoc refiner program and not related to the fact that there are 2 refiner steps branching off of map records. I'll continue narrowing down the issue.

It seems that the SwapDoc refiner program has 2 fields with the same name, which I believe is the cause of the issues. Still narrowing down to fully understand how its causing the issue and what is the correct bug fix. But also I'm curious how they created this refiner program. As far as I know, the Refiner app prevents you from having duplicate field names. So either they edited the refiner program themselves to create this field with an existing name, or an old version of refiner allowed 2 fields with the same name
are the two fields extracting the same thing? can we just ask them to modify their refiner?

confirming that the issue goes away when renaming the second `__counterpartyInformationAreaDesignated` field to be called something different, and still trying to understand how exactly the duplicate field names cause the issue
ok I will ask the customer if they are willing to just update their refiner program

Ok, I believe my backport PR fixes the root cause of the problem, but I would still advise capital one to not have duplicate field names in their refiner because those 2 fields actually have different formulas, which means other fields that depend on the duplicated fields will probably have some unexpected results

FYI: https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C041XGH39UN/p1680064937521279
please make sure to mention this info in the certify request, I had to dig this out from the jira to follow up.
